mods.abstract: Committed to the Jail OF the parish of Caddo, in the town of Shreveport, a negro man, aged about twenty-five years, some five feet four or five inches high, and of griffe complexionCalls himself WILLIAM, and says that he belongs to MrCharles PBlanchard, of the parish of NatchitochesHe was apprehended on the public road, about 18 miles from ShreveportThe owner or owners of said negro is hereby notified to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, or he will be dealt with as the law directsWBSTURGES, Jailorjune10
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU LibrariesCopyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domainPermission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
